data.Sentence_cn: 课文39  作家之所需
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 39 What every writer wants

data.Sentence_cn: 职业作家是如何忽视他们在学校所学的写作知识的?
data.Sentence: How do professional writers ignore what they were taught at school about writing?

data.Sentence_cn: 我的认识的作家寥寥无几，
data.Sentence: I have known very few writers,

data.Sentence_cn: 然而凡是我所认识和尊敬的作家，都立即承认在他们动笔时，不清楚要写什么，怎么写。
data.Sentence: but those I have known and whom I respect, confess at once that they have little idea where they are going when they first set pen to paper.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们心中只在一个或两个角色。
data.Sentence: They have a character, perhaps two;

data.Sentence_cn: 他们处于急切不安的状态，而被当作是灵感。他们无不承认，一旦“旅程”开始，“目的地”常有急剧的变化。
data.Sentence: they are in that condition of eager discomfort which passes for inspiration all admit radical changes of destination once the journey has begun;

data.Sentence_cn: 据我所知，有位作家花了9个月的时间写了一部关克什米尔的小说，
data.Sentence: one, to my certain knowledge, spent nine months on a novel about Kashmir,

data.Sentence_cn: 后来却把整个故事背景换成了苏格兰高地。
data.Sentence: then reset the whole thing in the Scottish Highlands.

data.Sentence_cn: 我从未听说过任何一位作家像我们在学校那样，
data.Sentence: I never heard of anyone making a 'skeleton', as we were taught at school.

data.Sentence_cn: 在剪裁修改、构思时间、穿插情节、以至从头重写的过程中，
data.Sentence: In the breaking and remaking, in the timing interweaving, beginning afresh,

data.Sentence_cn: 作家会领悟到素材中很多东西是他刚动笔时所未意识到的。
data.Sentence: the writer comes to discern things in his material which were not consciously in his mind when he began.

data.Sentence_cn: 这种有机的加工过程往往达到不寻常自我发现的境界，具有难以言表的构思魅力。
data.Sentence: This organic process, often leading to moments of extraordinary self-discovery, is of an indescribable fascination.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个朦胧的形象出现在作家的脑海里，他左添一笔，右添一笔，形象反而消逝了；
data.Sentence: A blurred image appears; he adds a brushstroke and another and it is gone

data.Sentence_cn: 可是，好像还有什么东西存在着，不把它捕捉到，作家是不会罢休的。
data.Sentence: but something was there, and he will not rest till he has captured it.

data.Sentence_cn: 有时，一个作家一本书写完了，但兴奋仍不消散。
data.Sentence: Sometimes the yeast within a writer outlives a book he has written.

data.Sentence_cn: 我听说一些作家，除了自己的书外，别的书一概不读，
data.Sentence: I have heard of writers who read nothing but their own books;

data.Sentence_cn: 犹如希腊神话中那位漂亮的少年，站在镜前，
data.Sentence: like adolescents they stand before the mirror,

data.Sentence_cn: 不能辨认自身的真面目。
data.Sentence: and still cannot fathom the exact outline of the vision before them.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于这个原因，作家喋喋不休地谈论自己的书，
data.Sentence: For the same reason, writers talk interminably about their own books,

data.Sentence_cn: 挖掘其隐晦的含义，
data.Sentence: winkling out hidden meanings, super-imposing new ones,

data.Sentence_cn: 询问周围人的反应。
data.Sentence: begging response from those around them.

data.Sentence_cn: 作家如此行事当然被人误解。他还不如给人讲一个犯罪案件或一个恋爱故事。
data.Sentence: Of course a writer doing this is misunderstood: he might as well try to explain a crime or a love affair.

data.Sentence_cn: 顺便说一句，他也是个不可饶恕的令人厌烦的人。
data.Sentence: He is also, incidentally, an unforgivable bore.

data.Sentence_cn: 这种企图消除自己和读者之间距离的作法，
data.Sentence: This temptation to cover the distance between himself and the reader,

data.Sentence_cn: 企图用不了解自己的人的观点来研究自己塑造的形象的作法，会导致作家的毁灭，因为他已经开始为取悦他人而写作了。
data.Sentence: to study his image in the sight of those who do not know him, can be his undoing: he has begun to write to please.

data.Sentence_cn: 一两年前，一位年轻的英国作家发表了中肯的看法。
data.Sentence: A young English writer made the pertinent observation a year or two back

data.Sentence_cn: 他说，初稿是才华，以后各稿是艺术。
data.Sentence: that the talent goes into the first draft, and the art into the drafts that follow.

data.Sentence_cn: 也是由于这个原因，作家同任何艺术家一样，
data.Sentence: For this reason also the writer, like any other artist,

data.Sentence_cn: 找不到可休息的场所，找不到伙伴和活动使自己得到安逸。
data.Sentence: has no resting place, no crowd or movement in which he may take comfort,

data.Sentence_cn: 任何局外人的判断也比不上他内心的正确判断。
data.Sentence: no judgment from outside which can replace the judgment from within.

data.Sentence_cn: 一旦作家从内心的紊乱中理出头绪，
data.Sentence: A writer makes order out of the anarchy of his heart;

data.Sentence_cn: 就应该按任何评论家想像不到的无情规范约束自己写作；
data.Sentence: he submits himself to a more ruthless discipline than any critic dreamed of,

data.Sentence_cn: 当他沽名钓誉时，他就脱离了自我生活，
data.Sentence: and when he flirts with fame, he is taking time off from living with himself,

data.Sentence_cn: 脱离了对自己灵魂最深处世界的探索。
data.Sentence: from the search for what his world contains at its inmost point.
